hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{413}$ |  $\maroonD4$ | $\maroonD1$ | $\maroonD3$
$\blueE{482}$ | $\blueE4$ | $\blueE8$ | $\blueE2$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{413}=\maroonD{4\text{ hundreds}} + \maroonD{1\text{ ten}} + \maroonD{3\text{ ones}}$.  

$\blueE{482}= \blueE{4\text{ hundreds}} + \blueE{8\text{ tens}}+ \blueE{2\text{ ones}}$.
$4\text{ hundreds} + 4\text{ hundreds} + 1 \text{ ten}+8\text{ tens} +3 \text{ ones}+2 \text{ ones}$ is the same as $413 + 482$.

question.content:
**What do we get when we break apart $413+482$ using place value?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: $\small 4\text{ hundreds} + 4\text{ hundreds} + 1 \text{ ten}+2\text{ tens} +8 \text{ ones}+3 \text{ ones}$
$\small 4\text{ hundreds} + 4\text{ tens} + 1 \text{ ten}+8\text{ tens} +3 \text{ ones}+2 \text{ ones}$
$\small 4\text{ hundreds} + 4\text{ hundreds} + 1 \text{ ten}+8\text{ tens} +3 \text{ ones}+2 \text{ ones}$
